meanings.definition: A person who fights bulls in a bullfight.
meanings.sent1: The brave toreadors faced the fierce bull in the arena.
meanings.sent2: The crowd cheered as the toreadors entered the bullring.
meanings.sent3: The toreadors decided to have a dance-off with the bull instead of fighting.
meanings.sent4: In the business world, the CEO is like a toreador, facing challenges head-on.
meanings.sent5: The toreadors' colorful costumes added a touch of excitement to the bullfight.

meanings.sent1: At the event, the toreadors gathered to discuss their strategies.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed paintings of famous toreadors throughout history.
meanings.sent3: The group of toreadors accidentally wore matching outfits to the bullfight.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the toreadors traveled together to different bullrings.
meanings.sent5: The book described the adventures of the daring toreadors in great detail.
